definitions.definition: Literary type using invented or imaginative writing, instead of real facts , usually written as prose .
examples: I am a great reader of fiction .
the fiction section of the library

definitions.definition: A verbal or written account that is not based on actual events (often intended to mislead).
examples: The company’s accounts contained a number of blatant fictions .
The butler’s account of the crime was pure fiction .
separate the fact from the fiction

main_definition: ( literature ) Literary type using invented or imaginative writing, instead of real facts , usually written as prose .
secondary_definitions: A verbal or written account that is not based on actual events (often intended to mislead).
